column1: News of a second viable COVID vaccine should clear the way for massive economic assistance from Congress. We see the finish line. We can support families and small businesses until we get there.

11 million people did not need to catch COVID. We can stop the next 11 million from catching it by instituting a comprehensive public health response and sending families & small businesses the economic assistance they need to make it through the pandemic.
Being a young person in America was hard enough before the pandemic. Now children account for 1 out of every 11 COVID. We can do better for our kids. https://t.co/g3XH1A1TGf
When the stock market rises the day 160000 Americans are diagnosed with COVID you know something is fundamentally wrong with our system.

I am glad that Pfizer’s COVID-19 vaccine is showing significant promise in its late stage trials (MI pride!). Let’s keep following the science and distribute a vaccine as quickly and safely as possible. Oh and it needs to be free.

The President spent nine months trying to cover up COVID-19. Less than a week after winning the election Joe Biden has brought together a team of public health experts to chart a new course that respects science and the well-being of our hardest hit communities.

Trump on his inauguration: 1 2 3… it’s the biggest crowd ever! Trump on 2020: 1 2 3… I won! I won PA MI AZ NV and GA! Trump on Covid cases: 1 2 3… I’d say we’re rounding the turn.    I didn’t know it was possible that your ego could affect your counting skills.

Right to the end even concerning life-and-death development of treatments for COVID-19 Trump’s corruption knows no bounds. He is giving up to $65000000 in taxpayer funds to a big Republican donor to test blood plasma technology. 1/

Congratulations to the Michigan health care workers who won these well-deserved raises. I am fighting to make sure essential workers are both celebrated and fairly compensated for their work during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/eaMS71YeIk

The lack of a national response to the pandemic has put our schools in such a poor position that teachers may be leaving the profession to avoid COVID. Our children can’t afford another shock to their education. Congress needs to help schools now. https://t.co/KEMpDwyV55

The record COVID case numbers we’ve seen over the past week are a clear sign we need a national testing and tracing strategy like the one I outlined fully five months ago in my Coronavirus Containment Corps Act.

The consequences of Republican’s inaction on COVID relief are painfully visible. We should be sending our universities the funding needed to cover shortfalls caused by the pandemic. Idly watching schools slash programs and faculty is a dereliction of Congress’s duty.
Congress has the tools to mount an effective public health and economic response to the COVID-19 pandemic and I will not stop fighting to see it carried out. 11/

It is clear from the votes last week that Senate Republicans haven’t moved beyond the cynicism preventing them from actually negotiating a COVID relief bill with Democrats but there is still time to act. 2/
I have some thoughts to share on last week’s COVID relief negotiations 1/

We have the answers to the rising number of COVID-19 cases: a nationwide testing and tracing program private sector manufacturers backed and guided by the Defense Production Act and economic relief for families. 1/

The bill undoes the harmful prohibition of electronic voting in union elections and requires the NLRB to conduct elections remotely due to the public health risks of in-person voting during the coronavirus pandemic. 9/

The President’s inability & unwillingness to provide state &  local with economic relief is putting hundreds of thousands of good-paying government jobs at risk. I’m advocating for a Coronavirus Containment Corps which would put Americans back to work and protect communities.

We’ve passed the tragic benchmark of 8 million COVID-19 cases but we can still act. We need a comprehensive national response to the virus and we need it before we get to 9 million 10 million or worse.

People ask me whether we really want to make a deal with Rs on another COVID relief package so close to the election. Can you lend me a rooftop to shout from? Yes!!! Whenever we can agree on a plan that actually delivers will be not a moment too soon.  https://t.co/kqOigU3NlA

Moms in my district have talked to me about how hard it is for them during COVID to get to the grocery store safely or at all. We clearly need safe alternatives to the traditional in-store shopping in the WIC program and my bill will make sure those get developed. 8//
The bill also includes my bipartisan legislation that would modernize WIC the COVID-19 WIC Safety and Modernization Act. 7/

Trump’s response to COVID-19 is such a disaster that one of our most esteemed apolitical scientific journals @NEJM felt the need to weigh in on an election for the first time since it was founded when Americans got around in horse-drawn carriages. https://t.co/kEoN6uQ0DW
Hampering COVID relief negotiations with late night tweets hurts the American people the economy and the president’s image. It’s unfathomable why the president continues to flip-flop on COVID relief.

The American people need relief – and they need it now. President Trump flip-flopping on negotiations when the House has already passed another coronavirus relief package adds to the list of ways he has mishandled this deadly virus and caused hardworking Americans to suffer.

I’m urging the Senate to call the President’s bluff on COVID relief and to deliver for the American people. Put a bill on his desk and prove that your job is more than rubberstamping right-wing judges. https://t.co/DdHAkEx2Et

.@HouseDemocrats passed an updated version of the Heroes Act a $2.2 trillion coronavirus relief package. This bill includes key provisions from my Coronavirus Containment Corps Act with @SenatorWarren to establish a nationwide COVID-19 contact tracing program.
I'm grateful to have key provisions of my Coronavirus Containment Corps and my bipartisan COVID-19 WIC Safety and Modernization Act included in the Updated Heroes Act. More: https://t.co/GLQErSTQ2w

Both the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recognize that naming COVID-19 by its geographic location or linking it to a specific ethnicity perpetuates stigma. It’s also completely unscientific.

I am proud to have voted for the House Resolution condemning racism towards Asian people that has flared during the COVID-19 pandemic. It is unacceptable that the president has openly embraced racism towards Asians in his response to the coronavirus.
Residents of Macomb and Oakland Counties can find a list of COVID-19 testing sites below:  https://t.co/ORn8PicYvC  https://t.co/AQuR0zVMyo
Thank you Beaumont Urgent Care for putting together this list of COVID-19 testing sites in Southeast Michigan. If you think you’ve been exposed to COVID-19 please get tested! https://t.co/qoWNFqFmmi

The passage of the government funding bill shows we can successfully negotiate on a bipartisan bicameral basis. Instead of a divisive and rushed #SCOTUS confirmation process the Senate should come back to the table so we can pass much needed COVID relief #ForThePeople.

Tragically we have now officially lost 200000 American sisters brothers mothers fathers children friends & neighbors to COVID-19. I grieve with my constituents for these individuals. May each of their memories be for a blessing.
MI is Exhibit A for a strong response to COVID-19.  Governor Whitmer has saved hundreds or even thousands of lives.

I'm proud to have voted YES today on @RepGraceMeng's resolution to condemn the many manifestations of anti-Asian prejudice that have arisen with COVID-19 and to denounce the anti-Asian anti-Islamic anti-woman bigotry of Pastor Muns. Thank you for stepping forward @sarahjeong. https://t.co/dw0PZNApLb

COVID-19 presents challenges for both substance use disorders and recovery. I'm wearing purple to let you know there is hope I am with you and help is available. #RecoveryMonth #EndTheStigma   https://t.co/0h0ZDyy8W9 https://t.co/2vS2GDFH5D
This tool shows the rate of Covid-19 spread in the United States. Right now a new American is diagnosed with Covid-19 every 2.5 seconds. https://t.co/PPH5D5bGYo

We’re already witnessing the greatest failure of executive leadership in American history. What’s coming could be worse. The White House and Senate Republican must negotiate with Democrats to pass comprehensive COVID-19 relief immediately.    https://t.co/5l9lJDZV3H

The GOP COVID relief bill offers less than a quarter of the money we need for testing and tracing. That might be enough for us to watch helplessly as case numbers rise again this fall and winter. It’s not close to enough for any sort of effective response to the pandemic.
14 million American children are going hungry tonight. The new GOP COVID relief bill offers these children zero – I repeat $0 – funding for nutrition assistance.

Over 400000 Americans stand to lose their lives to COVID-19 before the end of the year unless our government institutes a comprehensive response to the pandemic. The time to act is now. Pass the #HeroesAct. Build out the Coronavirus Containment Corps.

I have spent the last month back in my district on Zoom calls or at a distance in-person hearing from constituents how desperately a new COVID relief package is needed. From laid-off workers wanting to know if their unemployment benefits will continue. 1/

As the President forced & encouraged states to reopen their economies with the pandemic out of control workplaces saw deadly outbreaks of COVID-19. We must strengthen workers’ right to bargain for wages benefits & safer workplaces to combat this assault on our public health.
Over the past several months #COVID19 has plunged our nation into a worker safety crisis and the Trump administration has failed to act. We must stand up for workers’ right to safe workplaces.
Did the President just buy COVID-19 its own PR firm?  https://t.co/otBi1baLSi

More than 54 million people may be experiencing food insecurity due to #COVID19 disproportionately Americans of color. Sec. Mnuchin & Republicans won’t show up to ensure Americans have food on their dinner table.  #HeroesAct

The first step to fixing the economy is addressing the public health crisis. Yet Sec. Mnuchin & Republicans continue to reject the funding needed for comprehensive testing + tracing. We need a national strategy & robust funding to contain #coronavirus & safely reopen the economy.

Though the justice system hardly treats them this way incarcerated Americans are humans too and they have a right to be able to communicate with their loved ones and their legal counsel. COVID has already made this hard enough by reducing visitations. https://t.co/l4KGwMSwED

Latina workers suffered 20% unemployment in April and 15% in June. What will these women do now that $600/wk has expired? We need to raise Latinx voices right now and center COVID relief around the communities most affected by the pandemic. @EconomicPolicy #Latinx #POC #Covid19 https://t.co/Rg8Mgf7BWI

It's been 100 days since the House passed the #HeroesAct to fight COVID-19.    4 million new cases in that time. 80000 more deaths.   How much suffering must American families undergo before Republicans in Congress and the White House are ready to act?

We can’t let Trump dismantle the USPS in the run-up to an election where mail-in ballots will be vital to ensuring Americans can safely exercise their right to vote. I’m voting this weekend to send @USPS the resources it needs during the COVID-19 pandemic. #DontMessWithUSPS
My statement on MI receiving an unemployment assistance grant from FEMA. #Covid19 #unemploymentbenefits   https://t.co/sqbzGj95WL

Transferring COVID-positive detainees across to new facilities. Pepper spraying those who protest. In the death throws of the Trump Administration ICE is reaching new levels of depravity. #AirICE #covid19 #coronavirus https://t.co/ly68lVUxWM

LGBT people face dire threats in El Salvador and in many other countries – and those threats are even worse during the ongoing COVID pandemic. The U.S. should not be deporting COVID-positive refugees to their home countries.” https://t.co/eKojBDy6h1

Trump+COVID is warping reality in so many ways. Weekly UI Claims <1M for 1st Time in 5 months presented as something to celebrate.   Hardly.   Claims are still 40%+ higher than any month pre-Trump+COVID. Flat out disaster not “happy days are here again.”  https://t.co/ueqNbrDAIo

When the president is MIA and we can’t have a true national strategy to deal with COVID-19 I’m proud of Governor Whitmer for joining a group of 6 bipartisan governors to deploy 3 million rapid tests. Call it a sub-national strategy at least on one item.  https://t.co/qkyJ15s57I

Everyone is so eager to go back to "normal" and we’re missing the point on how we get there–nationwide contact tracing! The Senate MUST take up the HEROES Act before recess and get key provisions of the Coronavirus Containment Corps in place at long last. https://t.co/DISRtdsu3h

Is America big enough to learn from others? Let’s pass my Coronavirus Containment Corps Act and get going. People are dying every day because @realDonaldTrump won’t follow simple science — there’s no time to waste!  https://t.co/KGHPS3eqo9

Washing our hands is one of the most important things we can do to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and yet thousands of families entered this pandemic without running water. My colleagues and I are working to fix this critical issue of water affordability. https://t.co/qIhivAYUVA

This is excellent news but we must not rest on our laurels or fail to bring other states along with us. We need the Coronavirus Containment Corps to support contact tracing nationally and for the long haul. https://t.co/uMHMsBfAH4

This is remarkable and shows us what's possible with a nationwide public health-driven effort to stop COVID-19.   That's what @SenWarren & my Coronavirus Containment Corps Act is about.   Learn more here: https://t.co/1oo069qvo4 https://t.co/QHWRbZLDqo

Join my town halls this week w/ @LtGovGilchrist to discuss the issues facing our communities as we move into a new phase of our coronavirus response and as the dialogue around systemic racism continues. ☎️ on 6/10: https://t.co/EpDBNWI5yY 🎥 on 6/11: https://t.co/TzPA1nDVD0

White privilege is a huge mountain rising from the American landscape its consequences devastating and in plain sight. Why do we act like we can’t see it? Why do we debate whether it exists when its impact in lives lost to COVID-19 to maternal mortality to police violence.

Looking at my district: In Macomb County black individuals make up 26.08% Macomb COVID cases and 20.76% of deaths. In comparison 2018 estimates say the black community is 12% of the total Macomb population. This is staggering and sad. https://t.co/2VFLE4vLvY
This Asian Pacific American Heritage Month join me in honoring the more than 2 million #AAPI health care providers and essential workers who are on the front lines of the #COVID19 crisis. #APAHM

As many auto workers return to their plants today my eyes are on the same prize as the @UAW’s–-workers' health and safety. I'm pushing for comprehensive testing and the creation of the Coronavirus Containment Corps so folks can be assured of their safety returning to work.

The Heroes Act includes $75B for a national program including much of @SenWarren’s and my Coronavirus Containment Corps plan. It’s time for the Senate and President to join us in saving lives and getting people back to work and school safely. https://t.co/MXDUTkkTUf

Other governments from Australia to Taiwan have kept #COVID19 deaths per million people below 10 while in the U.S. we’ve lost 271 per million. They have stood up testing tracing and supported isolation at national scale. We have not.

Americans are looking to Congress to help keep them healthy & reopen the economy.  @HouseDemocrats today will pass the #HeroesAct that includes $75B for testing & contact tracing & adopts key parts of @SenWarren’s and my Coronavirus Containment Corps Act.  https://t.co/yOi5zmsvts

.@SenWarren’s and my Coronavirus Containment Corps harnesses the same imagination and ingenuity of FDR's Civilian Conservation Corps to move our country past this pandemic while making a major investment in the American workforce. https://t.co/bJQB2VBq7a

To reopen our economy immediately get dislocated workers back on the job and get #COVID19 under control we need a national contact tracing program. I’m proud to work with @SenWarren on the plan to create the Coronavirus Containment Corps. Read our op-ed: https://t.co/MXDUTkkTUf
I am proud to be rolling to Washington DC to vote on our next package of bills to counteract the #COVID19 crisis in a Dodge Ram made right in Sterling Heights! https://t.co/wKQq56JFIt

Today @HouseDemocrats are honoring first responders health care workers Americans struggling with unemployment due to the #COVID19 crisis and more by introducing the #HEROESAct. We’re taking big steps to help the hardest hit Americans—@SenateGOP should join us and do the same.

Libraries and the digital resources they provide are more important than ever during the #COVID19 pandemic. I’m proud to support @ALALibrary and their coalition of government business and education leaders calling for greater library support funding in future relief legislation. https://t.co/F9jyImT0xk

We must harness the same imagination FDR demonstrated a century ago. Let’s put many tens of thousands of unemployed folks to work contact tracing and helping people isolate safely. That's what @SenWarren's & my Coronavirus Containment Corps is all about. https://t.co/LZhCkInvzH

#COVID19 has shown us just how hard educators work to help our kids learn and grow. This #TeacherAppreciationWeek we thank all teachers who are going above and beyond to serve their students. #ThankATeacher https://t.co/ikbD4uQHtx

My vote for the CARES Act was a vote to bring urgent assistance to Macomb and Oakland Counties and it is my hope that these substantial funds will bolster the #COVID19 response in Metro Detroit and bring us closer to the end of this crisis. https://t.co/UkeP32XClP

Today is #WorkersMemorialDay. Let us take time to remember those we’ve lost reflect on the value and dignity of labor and consider ways in which we can better protect workers – particularly those on the frontlines of the #COVID19 epidemic.

This #NationalLibraryWeek @RepRaulGrijalva @repdonyoung & I led a bipartisan letter with more than 100 House members urging support for America's libraries in future #COVID19 legislation. During this crisis our libraries are more important than ever. https://t.co/UA1zaFUTXL

To stop the spread of COVID-19 & reopen America we must massively expand our public health workforce to   ✅Investigate cases  ✅Identify positive individuals’ contacts ✅Ensure those contacts can take precautions    See @SenWarren’s & my plan to do it:   https://t.co/fRT1e3e4RK

During the Great Depression FDR put 100000s of Americans back to work with the Civilian Conservation Corps (CCC).   Today @SenWarren & I announced our plan for a new CCC: the Coronavirus Containment Corps. Learn how we can stop COVID-19 & reopen the US: https://t.co/LZhCkI5Ub7

These deportations are immoral and they put both Americans and Haitians at risk. If more cases of #COVID19 develop in countries like Haiti that cannot contain them even if we stop the spread here the virus will remain a short plane ride away. Please @ICEgov do not do this. https://t.co/43egVt4RiV

We should be making it easier for unions to hold elections not harder. My bipartisan letter with @RepBrianFitz and 166 other House members asks leadership to provide funding in a future #COVID19 bill to develop an electronic elections system for unions.   https://t.co/MehjjhRZqF

The coronavirus pandemic has exposed the problems of structural racism of not having national health insurance of disinvestment in public health systems. We must meet this moment by turning a corner towards a more progressive and inclusive vision for America.

It only makes it harder for us to fight the #coronavirus worldwide—a fight that we must win for as we have learned the hard way viruses know no borders. Decisions do not come more short-sighted than this.

Last night the president did what he does best in a crisis: blame somebody else. Cutting off funding to the @WHO does not erase the president’s failure to respond quickly and effectively to the #COVID19 pandemic nor does it undo his lies that have endangered Americans’ health.
Proud to work with @RepBonamici and 49 of our colleagues to make essential investments in workforce development and address the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/RAgmur96H6
A new unity government in Israel must not create an additional international crisis while the entire world reckons with the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/WxMbC2DyH5

To keep Michiganders safe and mitigate the spread of the #coronavirus as effectively as possible we must provide direct aid to cities townships and villages. That's what I'm fighting for. https://t.co/njMJJLOTps

File this under not surprising: Trump’s financial self-interest could be to blame for promoting this unproven drug for COVID-19.  Mr. President I beg of you get to work using the full power of the Defense Production Act to make the supplies we need that we KNOW will save lives. https://t.co/xkTTkmLbJG

Germany’s experience with COVID-19 makes me furious and hopeful all at once. They have done so well. We have done so poorly. We can and must ramp up massive and comprehensive testing and tracing even if it’s harder with a leadership vacuum at the top. https://t.co/S0SS4bM98L
.@HouseDemocrats are putting #FamiliesFirst as we confront the coronavirus. Learn more about the #CARESAct and the resources available to you and your family in this toolkit: https://t.co/gw1MOwGu0S

I’m hearing from mayors what I’ve heard from health care workers & others: we so desperately must increase #COVID19 testing capacity.   We need the president to organize the procurement and distribution of testing kits and PPE and he must use the #DefenseProductionAct to do it. https://t.co/obCZSya9mQ

I’m proud that @UAW workers right here in Michigan will be manufacturing supplies that are essential to the COVID-19 response effort. @Ford and @GM have stepped up in the tradition of the Arsenal of Democracy and I am grateful to them for that.

I am simply outraged. Last week a local nurse told me she got 1 N95/shift. Now it's 1 surgical mask/7 days. Hospitals will not have enough PPE for staff to resuscitate COVID-19 patients. @realDonaldTrump we need a far-reaching Defense Production Act. https://t.co/OcAeSPjIBn

Thank you Gov the organizers and  the MI Delegation who worked so hard on this and #MI09’s @SafeWaterEng who has been educating my staff and me on this and other water issues. Everyone needs running water in their homes to do their part to stem the spread of COVID-19 period. https://t.co/qrgMeqdIvK

President Trump must use the Act to coordinate a holistic response to the epidemic and active the full potential of American businesses to resolve the shortages that hamper our health systems’ response to COVID-19.

I have been calling repeatedly on the president to use the Defense Production Act to address the COVID-19 pandemic. However the #DefenseProductionAct must be used as a tool to work with the private sector—not as a cudgel against individual companies.

Big news! The House passed the #CARESAct a $2.2 trillion investment and relief package as a third part of our response to #COVID19. It’s not a perfect bill but we must make as much progress as we can and then get right back to work. That’s what I’m doing. #CARESActStatement https://t.co/a1dNXQgole
Looking for information about the coronavirus? Visit my website for a regularly updated list of resources news and ways that you can support the response effort.  https://t.co/JA6nFMGNJV

Proud to lead a bipartisan res'n calling on the President to use the Defense Production Act now & get Americans masks ventilators & more. Today I spoke with representatives from all 21 municipalities in Michigan’s 9th District about their needs regarding #COVID19. My main takeaway is this: We desperately need greater testing capacity and more personal protective equipment. This is a matter of life or death.

Thank God the Big Three have listened to their employees & shut down production temporarily due to #COVID19. It shouldn’t have taken direct action by FCA workers to get it done but I’m so  proud of them for pushing the issue of putting workers’ health & safety first.

Invoking the Defense Production Act was a great step and I thank the president.   This is what 56 House colleagues and I urged him to do last week.   It is essential that the president use all authorities granted to him to address #COVID19.  My statement: https://t.co/YWwEmu2CKD
